questions.question_text: Which stats command function provides a count of how many unique values exist for a given field in the result set?

discussion.content:
Answer "A"

his example creates a chart of how many new users go online each hour of the day.

... | sort _time | streamstats dc(userid) as dcusers | delta dcusers as deltadcusers | timechart sum(deltadcusers)

The dc (or distinct_count) function returns a count of the unique values of userid and renames the resulting field dcusers.
dc() means distinct count. A is the correct answer

Selected Answer: A
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/9.0.0/SearchReference/Aggregatefunctions
"Returns the count of distinct values of the field X. This function processes field values as strings. To use this function, you can specify distinct_count(X), or the abbreviation dc(X). "

A is correct
pag 120 distinct_count, dc – returns a count of unique values for a given field
"A" (D is a dash NOT underscore, hence wrong) page 120 pdf

comments.content: The question wants unique values, so it has to be A

discussion.content: A or B is correct
is correct
A, page 9

questions.question_text: A collection of items containing things such as data inputs, UI elements, and knowledge objects is known as what?

discussion.content: it's actually 221 pg on the Splunk fundamental pdf
A is the answer according to me.

A is correct
pag 213 Splunk alerts are based on searches that can run either:
– On a regular scheduled interval
– In real-time

comments.content: it's actually 221 pg on the Splunk fundamental pdf

choices.B: Alerts are based on searches and when triggered will only send an email notification.
choices.C: Alerts are based on searches and require cron to run on scheduled interval.
choices.A: Alerts are based on searches that are either run on a scheduled interval or in real-time.
choices.D: Alerts are based on searches that are run exclusively as real-time.

questions.question_text: Which statement is true about Splunk alerts?
What is the purpose of using a by clause with the stats command?

choices.B: To compute numerical statistics on each field.
choices.A: To group the results by one or more fields.
choices.D: To partition the input data based on the split-by fields.
choices.C: To specify how the values in a list are delimited.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
refer to https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/7.2.6/SearchReference/Stats

A is correct
pag 123 by clause returns a count for each value of a named field or set of fields

questions.question_text: How do you add or remove fields from search results?

discussion.content: The minus symbol for the correct answer is not displayed correctly

Selected Answer: C
C - Use fields + to add and fields - to remove (is the correct answer)
"field is not a Splunk command, it is fields"

Selected Answer: C
fields + and fields - are used
C is correct

"field" is not a valid Splunk command, it's "fields"

typo "fields-"

I have to go with C. "fields" is plural in the Splunk documentation not singular. In answer C, there is no minus sign to remove, but 2 symbols and a quotation mark in the answer. use fields + to add add
